title: The 12 Best Cowboy Boots for Summer Concerts and Beyond
description: In our opinion, boots are a great footwear option year-round. We love that we can wear them with everything from jeans to skirts to shorts and even jorts -even in the summer, when it's blisteringly hot, having a closed toed shoe at a concert, bar, or event can be a lifesaver. While the Western-inspired boot has been popular for some time now, this season, we're going full cowboy boots, and we couldn't be more excited about it. These boots are statement-making yet surprisingly wearable, and frankly, they'll make you feel like a badass. Because there are a lot of options out there, we've narrowed it down to these 12 top pairs of cowboy boots. These are our favorites on the market; some are short, some are tall, some are neutral, and some are printed, but they're all going to add a cool touch to any look. We're eyeing a black cowboy boot we can wear everywhere, a pink cowboy boot that's fun and whimsical, and a white cowboy boot that we can wear all summer long. We're already dreaming of all the outfits we can create with these fun boots (hello, Cowboy Carter). Just keep reading to shop our picks!
author: India Yaffe
excerpt: These cool cowboy boots are so versatile, comfortable, and on trend right now.
text: Skip to main contentWhile each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.In our opinion, boots are a great footwear option year-round. We love that we can wear them with everything from jeans to skirts to shorts and even jorts —even in the summer, when it's blisteringly hot, having a closed toed shoe at a concert, bar, or event can be a lifesaver. While the Western-inspired boot has been popular for some time now, this season, we're going full cowboy boots, and we couldn't be more excited about it. These boots are statement-making yet surprisingly wearable, and frankly, they'll make you feel like a badass.Because there are a lot of options out there, we've narrowed it down to these 12 top pairs of cowboy boots. These are our favorites on the market; some are short, some are tall, some are neutral, and some are printed, but they're all going to add a cool touch to any look. We're eyeing a black cowboy boot we can wear everywhere, a pink cowboy boot that's fun and whimsical, and a white cowboy boot that we can wear all summer long. We're already dreaming of all the outfits we can create with these fun boots (hello, Cowboy Carter). Just keep reading to shop our picks!stevemadden.comWhite Cowboy Boots: Steve Madden HaywardYes, everyone needs a great black boot, but there's also room for some fun. These bright white Steve Madden Hayward Boots ($70) make us smile. Plus, white boots are great for the summer, and they look so pretty with a white dress or shorts and a t-shirt.amazon.comSparkly Boots: Matisse Party Favor Western BootsThese Matisse Party Favor Western Boots ($97, originally $180) make us smile. These are the fun shoes, the pair you wear to a concert, a night out or a birthday or bachelorette party. They're whimsical, adorable, and about as cute as it gets. Shop them now while they're in stock!nordstrom.comShort Cowboy Boots: Free People New Frontier Suede BootiesThis season calls for these Free People New Frontier Suede Booties ($158). The style is unique and fun for nights out. Plus, a short boot is a summer staple. If you're going to a concert or outdoor event and don't want to be in an open toed sandal, go with these sturdy boots.anthropologie.comEmbellished Boots: Dingo 1969 Full Bloom Leather Cowboy BootsThese Dingo 1969 Full Bloom Leather Cowboy Boots ($170) are some of our favorite boots we've ever seen. They've got floral detailing that's bound to rack in compliments. If you're someone who loves a fun shoe, but wants to keep the colorway more neutral, go with these shoes.idyllwind.comGreen Boots: Dallas Alice Tall Cowboy BootWe're green with envy over these cool, elegant Dallas Alice Green Tall Western Boots ($220). They've got a 2.5 inch heel, which is ideal for walking around town in (or your next country concert). Pair them with a little black dress on a night out.nordstrom.comBlack Cowboy Boots: Jeffrey Campbell Dagget Western BootThese tall Jeffrey Campbell Dagget Western Boots ($270) are so cool. The black is super versatile, and the heel height is perfect. It gives you a little lift, but can still be worn everyday, which makes for the ideal boot. Pair them with jeans or a long dress.tecovas.comSuede Cowboy Boots: Isabel Marant Duerto Western Suede BootWe'd wear these Tecovas Sadie Boots ($325) with just about any outfit. The suede makes them stand out, and we like the idea of them with a long flowy dress. They do run a bit big though, so if you're nervous, try going down a size.allensboots.comPink Boots: Allen's Azulado Nora BootsWhen in doubt, think pink. If you're feeling like you want a fun, whimsical shoe, a pink cowboy boot will do just that. These Allen's Azulado Nora Boots ($400) are made out of goat leather, and this pink shade really speaks to us. These boots were definitely made to be seen (even with their short height). ba-sh.comHeeled Boots: ba&sh Caitlin Suede Ankle BootsThese ba&sh Caitlin Suede Ankle Boots ($485) are the more serious take on a cowboy boot. If you want the western look, but also like something a little more polished, a skinny stiletto heel is the way to go. Plus, especially for the way they look, they're surprisingly comfortable, and come in a few different shades.mytheresa.comKnee High Cowboy Boots: Isabel Marant Denvee Suede Knee-high BootsIf you're looking to dip your toe into the cowboy boot trend, try these Isabel Marant Denvee Suede Knee-high Boots ($876, originally $1,095). They're tall and polished but still look like a western boot. Plus, suede is so luxe, and we love the way it looks with a skirt or shorts.mytheresa.comLuxury Cowboy Boots: Saint Laurent Marant Suede BootsIf you feel like treating yourself, go with these stunning Saint Laurent Isabel Marant Suede Boots ($920, originally $1,150). They come in a few different styles, but the fringed brown suede is a winner to us. They also have a two inch heel, giving you the perfect little lift while still being great for everyday.goldengoose.comMid Calf Cowboy Boots: Golden Goose Wish Star Low BootsWe're into everything about these Golden Goose Wish Star Low Boots ($970). The leather is thick and feels so authentic and cool. Plus, the mid calf is one of our favorite silhouettes. It's a little bit tough, and a little bit luxe. If you're going to splurge, make it on these cool boots.-— Additional reporting by Haley LyndesHaley Lyndes is a shopping writer and editor with more than seven years of experience in the publishing space. Specializing in home and lifestyle, she covers everything from furniture and mattresses to beauty products and fitness gear. Previously, she was an SEO commerce writer for Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. Her writing has appeared in Buzzfeed, Travel & Leisure, and Real Simple. When she's not reviewing her latest home finds or interviewing celebrities, you'll likely find her out for a run — she's also a marathoner. India Yaffe was an associate editor on the Shopping team at PS for five years. She focused on curating the best fitness, fashion, beauty, and home products on the market for the PS audience.
html:
Skip to main content

While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

In our opinion, boots are a great footwear option year-round. We love that we can wear them with everything from jeans to skirts to shorts and even jorts —even in the summer, when it's blisteringly hot, having a closed toed shoe at a concert, bar, or event can be a lifesaver. While the Western-inspired boot has been popular for some time now, this season, we're going full cowboy boots, and we couldn't be more excited about it. These boots are statement-making yet surprisingly wearable, and frankly, they'll make you feel like a badass.

Because there are a lot of options out there, we've narrowed it down to these 12 top pairs of cowboy boots. These are our favorites on the market; some are short, some are tall, some are neutral, and some are printed, but they're all going to add a cool touch to any look. We're eyeing a black cowboy boot we can wear everywhere, a pink cowboy boot that's fun and whimsical, and a white cowboy boot that we can wear all summer long. We're already dreaming of all the outfits we can create with these fun boots (hello, Cowboy Carter). Just keep reading to shop our picks!

White Cowboy Boots: Steve Madden Hayward

Yes, everyone needs a great black boot, but there's also room for some fun. These bright white Steve Madden Hayward Boots ($70) make us smile. Plus, white boots are great for the summer, and they look so pretty with a white dress or shorts and a t-shirt.

Sparkly Boots: Matisse Party Favor Western Boots

These Matisse Party Favor Western Boots ($97, originally $180) make us smile. These are the fun shoes, the pair you wear to a concert, a night out or a birthday or bachelorette party. They're whimsical, adorable, and about as cute as it gets. Shop them now while they're in stock!

Short Cowboy Boots: Free People New Frontier Suede Booties

This season calls for these Free People New Frontier Suede Booties ($158). The style is unique and fun for nights out. Plus, a short boot is a summer staple. If you're going to a concert or outdoor event and don't want to be in an open toed sandal, go with these sturdy boots.

Embellished Boots: Dingo 1969 Full Bloom Leather Cowboy Boots

These Dingo 1969 Full Bloom Leather Cowboy Boots ($170) are some of our favorite boots we've ever seen. They've got floral detailing that's bound to rack in compliments. If you're someone who loves a fun shoe, but wants to keep the colorway more neutral, go with these shoes.

Green Boots: Dallas Alice Tall Cowboy Boot

We're green with envy over these cool, elegant Dallas Alice Green Tall Western Boots ($220). They've got a 2.5 inch heel, which is ideal for walking around town in (or your next country concert). Pair them with a little black dress on a night out.

Black Cowboy Boots: Jeffrey Campbell Dagget Western Boot

These tall Jeffrey Campbell Dagget Western Boots ($270) are so cool. The black is super versatile, and the heel height is perfect. It gives you a little lift, but can still be worn everyday, which makes for the ideal boot. Pair them with jeans or a long dress.

Suede Cowboy Boots: Isabel Marant Duerto Western Suede Boot

We'd wear these Tecovas Sadie Boots ($325) with just about any outfit. The suede makes them stand out, and we like the idea of them with a long flowy dress. They do run a bit big though, so if you're nervous, try going down a size.

Pink Boots: Allen's Azulado Nora Boots

When in doubt, think pink. If you're feeling like you want a fun, whimsical shoe, a pink cowboy boot will do just that. These Allen's Azulado Nora Boots ($400) are made out of goat leather, and this pink shade really speaks to us. These boots were definitely made to be seen (even with their short height).

Heeled Boots: ba&sh Caitlin Suede Ankle Boots

These ba&sh Caitlin Suede Ankle Boots ($485) are the more serious take on a cowboy boot. If you want the western look, but also like something a little more polished, a skinny stiletto heel is the way to go. Plus, especially for the way they look, they're surprisingly comfortable, and come in a few different shades.

Knee High Cowboy Boots: Isabel Marant Denvee Suede Knee-high Boots

If you're looking to dip your toe into the cowboy boot trend, try these Isabel Marant Denvee Suede Knee-high Boots ($876, originally $1,095). They're tall and polished but still look like a western boot. Plus, suede is so luxe, and we love the way it looks with a skirt or shorts.

Luxury Cowboy Boots: Saint Laurent Marant Suede Boots

If you feel like treating yourself, go with these stunning Saint Laurent Isabel Marant Suede Boots ($920, originally $1,150). They come in a few different styles, but the fringed brown suede is a winner to us. They also have a two inch heel, giving you the perfect little lift while still being great for everyday.

Mid Calf Cowboy Boots: Golden Goose Wish Star Low Boots

We're into everything about these Golden Goose Wish Star Low Boots ($970). The leather is thick and feels so authentic and cool. Plus, the mid calf is one of our favorite silhouettes. It's a little bit tough, and a little bit luxe. If you're going to splurge, make it on these cool boots.

— Additional reporting by Haley Lyndes

Haley Lyndes is a shopping writer and editor with more than seven years of experience in the publishing space. Specializing in home and lifestyle, she covers everything from furniture and mattresses to beauty products and fitness gear. Previously, she was an SEO commerce writer for Apartment Therapy and The Kitchn. Her writing has appeared in Buzzfeed, Travel & Leisure, and Real Simple. When she's not reviewing her latest home finds or interviewing celebrities, you'll likely find her out for a run — she's also a marathoner.

India Yaffe was an associate editor on the Shopping team at PS for five years. She focused on curating the best fitness, fashion, beauty, and home products on the market for the PS audience.
